channel.title: Ubuntu on UNH COMP RESOURCES
channel.description: Recent content in Ubuntu on UNH COMP RESOURCES

item.title: Creating partition on ubuntu during installation
item.description: Select Something else in installation dialog You will see your disk as /dev/sda or /dev/mapper/pdc_* Click “New Partition Table…” You will see that you have free space on your disk now: (Recommended) Create partition for swap. Swap is the partition for keeping unneeded memory pages, like Windows swap. Also it can be used for hibernation. Select free space and click + Set parameters like on the picture below: Notice that you should set swap size more than you have physical memory in order to use hibernation.

item.title: Ubuntu Installation Guide
item.description: A minimum of 8GB storage USB drive. Download an LTS (long term support) version of Ubuntu file from this link. Note: 16.04 or above is recommended as these are the most used versions Download and install Rufus from link Follow the instructions at link to create a bootable USB with Ubuntu Important: Print this document before proceeding in case you are working on the same machine you are trying to dual boot.
